security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate code review skill with no actual security risks. The static scanner produced 70 false positives by misinterpreting markdown documentation as code and flagging placeholder template content. The three Python scripts perform standard file operations for a review tool and contain no network calls, no external commands, and no actual cryptographic implementations. All 'findings' in the scanner report are pattern-matching false positives against documentation and template text.

low_findings.title: User-specified path file access
low_findings.description: Scripts accept a target path argument and access files within that directory. This is expected behavior for a code review tool.

content.user_title: Review code for quality and security
content.value_statement: Manual code review is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides automated analysis tools to check pull requests, identify issues, and generate review reports across multiple programming languages.
actual_capabilities: Analyze code quality in TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Swift, Kotlin, and Go
Generate structured review reports from analyzed code
Check pull requests against coding standards and best practices
Identify common code anti-patterns and security issues
Provide actionable recommendations for code improvements
Export review results in JSON format for integration
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Analysis rules are placeholder and require customization
No integration with CI/CD pipelines or version control
Does not modify code files automatically

use_cases.title: PR Code Review
use_cases.description: Review pull requests before merge to catch issues early and maintain code quality standards across the team.

use_cases.title: Quality Gate Checks
use_cases.description: Establish baseline quality checks that all code must pass before entering the main codebase.

use_cases.title: Security Pattern Scanning
use_cases.description: Scan code for common security vulnerabilities and provide remediation guidance to developers.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the code-reviewer skill to analyze this file and check for quality issues, security concerns, and best practice violations.

prompt_templates.title: PR Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the pr_analyzer on the changed files in this pull request. List all findings by severity and provide specific recommendations.

prompt_templates.title: Full Project Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute the code_quality_checker on the entire project directory. Generate a detailed report with metrics and improvement suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Standards Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the codebase against the coding_standards reference. Document all violations and provide corrected code examples.

output_examples.input: Review the authentication module for security issues
output: Recommendations: Use environment variables, add rate limiting, implement proper session management

output_examples.input: Analyze this Python file for code quality
output: Recommendation: Apply PEP 8 guidelines and optimize loop logic

output_examples.input: Check this pull request for best practices
output: Main Issues: Missing tests, inconsistent error handling

best_practices: Run code review before every pull request to catch issues early
Use the JSON output option to integrate review results with other tools
Combine automated analysis with manual review for comprehensive coverage
anti_patterns: Skipping review on small or urgent changes
Only checking syntax without analyzing logic or security
Not tracking review findings over time for patterns

faq.question: What languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Swift, Kotlin, and Go are officially supported.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code files?
faq.answer: No. The skill only analyzes and reports findings. It does not write or modify any source code.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: The JSON output format can be parsed by CI systems. Full integration requires custom scripting.

faq.question: Is my code data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. All analysis runs locally on your machine using Python scripts. No network calls are made.

faq.question: Why are the analysis results empty?
faq.answer: The scripts are templates with placeholder logic. Actual analysis rules need to be implemented based on your requirements.

faq.question: How does this compare to ESLint or Pylint?
faq.answer: This skill provides review workflow automation. Specialized tools like ESLint or Pylint offer deeper language-specific analysis rules.
